summary: This bill, titled "Making the CFPB Accountable to Small Businesses Act of 2025," amends the Dodd-Frank Act and Title 5 of the United States Code. It mandates that covered agencies, particularly the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), provide detailed justifications when proposed rules impact small entities, detailing the reasoning behind decisions that might not consider the size and resources of small businesses. It focuses on regulatory flexibility analysis to protect small businesses from potential negative impacts of new regulations.
